Notes

This build relies on Dragon Slash - Force (DT1) to deal most of its damage. Because of this, you must not delay Dragon Trigger and you have to use Dragon Slash - Force (DT1) almost immediately after triggering  Relic of Peitha.

Rotation

Precasts

  1. Gunsaber skills
  2. Utilty skills ( Flow Stabilizer x3 [^1]
  3. Mending
  • Use Tactical Reload to get the third Flow Stabilizer

Dragon Slash Combo

You MUST learn this combo:

  1. Dragon Trigger
  2. Flickerstep (triggers  Relic of Peitha)
  3. Dragon Slash - Force (ASAP when charged)
  • Be careful not to cancel your Dragon Trigger by moving!
  • Triggerguard can be added on for free aegis.

Simplified Loop

  1. Dragon Slash Combo
  2. Weapon Skills (5→1→Autos)
  3. Dragon Slash Combo
  4. Gunsaber (4→3→2→1→Autos)
  5. Dragon Slash Combo ↺
  • You may skip Sword 2 or keep the leap as a finisher when you need it.

Crowd Control

This build has weak crowd control. Replace Signet of Might with a physical skills that has CC:

  • Bull's Charge
  • Kick

Physical skills provide a short term buff through Peak Performance, so you can mitigate the damage loss for bringing a CC if you use Dragon Trigger right after using one of the above CC skills.

Video

This bench is made with budget utilities, food and no infusions.

entry.title: Power Chronomancer [pDPS]
entry.content:
Disclaimer: this build depends on a 9-year-old bug with Fencer's Finesse[1]

Notes

Power Chronomancer is primarily a priority based rotation, with an opener and one simple combo.

It is able to do large amounts of CC due to the free elite skill slot, and has multiple utility skills that can be swapped around for a minor DPS loss to provide many utilities, such as reflecting, blinking, portalling, aegis, or stability.

Majority of this build's damage is ranged, allowing it to have high damage uptime, increasing the effectiveness of this builds on bosses that move a lot.

Rotation

Always start with:

Opener:

  1. Phantasmal Swordsman (Sword 5)
  2. Phantasmal Disenchanter
  3. Signet of the Ether
  4. Phantasmal Swordsman (Sword 5)
  5. Phantasmal Disenchanter

Signet of the Ether instantly recharges the cooldown of any Phantasmal type skill, and is used to deal more damage.

Your combo is:

Combo:

  1. Signet of the Ether
  2. Phantasmal Swordsman (Sword 5)
  3. Phantasmal Disenchanter

And you should use your skills off cooldown with the following priority:

Skill Priority:

  1. Combo
  2. Split Second (with 3 clones)
  3. Phantasmal Swordsman (Sword 5)
  4. Phantasmal Disenchanter
  5. Bladecall (Dagger 2)
  6. Unstable Bladestorm (Dagger 3)
  7. Well of Calamity
  8. Well of Senility

Crowd Control

Your CC skills are, in order of priority

CC Skills:

  1. Signet of Humility (BIG CC)
  2. Well of Senility
  3. Time Sink (more clones more CC)

Advanced Tips

Distortion is also a very long immune skill, scaling up to a maximum of 3 seconds with the number of clones you currently have, and should be your panic button. It can also be used to dodge mechanics on various raids to increase your damage uptime.

 

You can block attacks with Illusionary Riposte (Sword 4), but it is not recommended unless you are very confident of the mechanic. An example of using this to increase DPS would be on Deimos, where it's cooldown is short enough to block both the knockback "pizza" mechanic and mindcrush, allowing you to maximise damage uptime on the boss.

 

More advanced tips coming soon

Video

  1. Fencer's Finesse is bugged, and activates on your phantasms and clones even if you're not using main-hand sword. It is a long known bug that happens even for every Condition Virtuoso, Power Chronomancer, and Power Boon Chronomancer build, and has not been fixed for a long time. It takes no setup and will activate as long as you are taking the trait Fencer's Finesse, and using a Sword in your offhand with any other mainhand weapon. Due to how general it is, it is almost impossible to avoid triggering this bug and we will proceed with the game assuming that it is intended behaviour. ↩

entry.title: Barbed Arrows [cDPS]
entry.content:
The purpose of writing this guide is to provide a no-weapon swap method to play a ranged PVE soulbeast while easily hitting the 70% benchmark with minimal effort. This build is low cognition, has few repetitions but has a relatively high APM. The skills do not require specific timing and having extra hard CC (total of 4) in the build allows flexible upkeep of Twice as Vicious, which has a rather tight timing on other builds. The auto-attack of the build provides sufficient hits to proc bleeding and the skills that empower the shortbow hits do not interrupt the attack rotation. The way the bows are empowered with bleeding stacks is inspired by the Guild Wars 1 skill Barbed Arrows.

As of 2025, the build has been updated to use the juvenile bee and shifts its damage focus more towards poison with a very decent extra 300 points of CC. Stat adjustments have been made to accomodate standard condition DPS food.

  •  Relic of the Fractal (test)

Utility

  •  Toxic Tuning Crystal

Pets

  1. The Janthiri Bee is competitive in damage and provides ready access CC, making it the default best option for raiding.
  2. The Wallow provides a poison field, decent healing and condition cleanses which is good in open world.
  3. Other options include the Bristleback, Jungle Spider, Jaguar, Warthog and Black Widow.

Build

Condi DPS\

[&DQQeLSAXNy55AHgAvwAAAOkWAAAbAAAALhYAAEdAEz8AAAAAAAAAAAAAAAA=]
Juvenile Wallow
Juvenile Janthiri Bee

Trait Alternatives

The equipment stats are fairly similar to the that of SnowCrows with selection of different traits.

Rotation and Utilities

DPS Rotation

Stay merged at all times.

  1. Early Precast - Spike Trap
  2. Pre-battle - One Wolf Pack + Sharpening Stone + Vulture Stance + Sharpen Spines (if using Bristleback)
  3. General Rotation - Use all non-healing skills on cooldown except F1

Crowd Control

  1. You have decent CC by just using Concussion Shot (Shortbow 4)
  2. You have many other CC skills littered in your weapon/pet/utility kit including the ones used to upkeep Twice as Vicious (see below).
  3. You can precast Sharpening Stone for additional CC just before the CC phase of an encounter.
  4. Your Pet F3 skill does a taunt. This is counted as decent CC.

Sustainability

  1. You may opt to take Healing Spring for better condi cleanse
  2. Quick Shot (Shortbow 3) is an evade that does a step back. This is useful for bosses with pull mechanics.
  3. If you need an extra heal, you may swap your pet to the Wallow for Spiritual Reprieve

Optimisation

Twice as Vicious

  1. Spread out Sharpening Stone, Primal Cry and Concussion Shot to maximise Twice as Vicious uptime.
  2. Use your other pet CC skills if your coverage is falling such as Bumble.
  3. You may wish to delay using Concussion Shot as it is a potent CC skill.

Dodging

  1. Where dodging is necessary, you may delay Quick Shot by 4s after the dodge to have better uptime of Light on your Feet.
  2. It is better to use Quick Shot to dodge once if you don't need to dodge twice for better DPS uptime.

Raid Ready

  1. W1 Gorseval - Immobilise with Entangle during the split phase.
  2. W2 Slothasor - Jaguar is useful for Prelude Lash to pull slublings. Make sure to point your bow away from ally slubs!
  3. W2 Bandit Trio - The range, self sustainability and high amounts of CC allows this build to do mortars.
  4. W3 Escort - For backwarg, bring Entangle and use Crippling Shot to immobilise. For frontwarg, black widow/jungle spider is useful for Prelude Lash to pull white mantle and Entangling Web provides meaningul immobilise uptime on the frontwarg.
  5. W4 Cairn - This build does superb on Cairn, no adjustment is necessary, though you may wish to use "We Heal As One!" if you are baiting red circles for the group. Also see dodge section above as you will very often be dodging to move if celestial dash is unavailable.
  6. W4 Samarog - Spike Trap can be used to launch Rigom, although the pushback from longbow and using a power build is preferred.
  7. W5 Dhuum - Use Quick Shot during the suck phase.
  8. W6 This build is excellent on Twin Largos as it is.
  9. This build can be used to pylon kite. Camp shortbow with Juvenile Hawk. Switch to sword. You movement skills are Swoop (catch) and Swoop(return). Take note that unlike other kiting classes, your return skill cannot survive dashing through fires.

entry.content:
Notes

A Sword priority-based build, with two different priority sets (in/out of forge).

This build is able to deal very high burst damage with no setup required. However, knowing how to save your burst by changing or delaying your rotation requires high levels of familiarity with the build, and if done incorrectly, will lose your more DPS than you would gain.

It also loses out in damage over time, and is weaker on fights with long phases.

Build

[&DQMGNyYvOTsqDwAA5RYAAKMAAABXFgAA8BUAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAADWgBXAFUAAA==]

Rotation

While playing Power Holosmith, you always want to Engage Photon Forge as soon as it is available, as most of your damage is done during Engage Photon Forge. As Engage Photon Forge replaces your weapon skill bar when it is cast, this rotation will consists of 2 different skill priority orders, during Engage Photon Forge and Holoforge Overheated.

Always cast Rifle Turret before the fight begins, and follow the priority of the mode you are currently in. Auto attack if you have no skills to press.

Engage Photon Forge Priority:

  1. Corona Burst (Forge 3)
  2. Photon Blitz (Forge 4)
  3. Photon Wall --> Launch Wall (above 50% heat)
  4. Laser Disk (above 50% heat)
  5. Prime Light Beam (above 50% heat)
  6. Blade Burst (above 50% heat)

Skip Prime Light Beam if it is on cooldown, and note that Photon Wall has be pressed twice to cast Launch Wall. As there is a delay between Photon Wall flipping over to reveal Launch Wall, I personally like to cast it in the order:

  1. Photon Wall
  2. Laser Disk
  3. Launch Wall

Allowing me to queue skill casts and not lose damage uptime.

Ultimately the order which you press the skills are not important, as long as you are able to squeeze in 2 x Corona Burst (Forge 3), 2 x Photon Blitz (Forge 4), 1 x Launch Wall, 1 x Prime Light Beam, and 1 x Blade Burst for every Engage Photon Forge.

Holoforge Overheated Priority:

  1. Refraction Cutter (Sword 2)
  2. Radiant Arc (Sword 3)

During Holoforge Overheated, you are basically just waiting for Engage Photon Forge to come off cooldown, and pressing any high damage weapon skills to upkeep damage as much as possible.

On top of your rotation, you should also

Cast Off Cooldown:

  1. Particle Accelerator
  2. Surprise Shot

Particle Accelerator and Surprise Shot do not have any cast time, and will not interrupt your current skill.

Crowd Control

Your CC skills are:

  1. Static Shock
  2. Magnetic Shield (Shield 4)
  3. Static Shield (Shield 5)

Both Magnetic Shield (Shield 4) and Static Shield (Shield 5) have to be pressed twice for CC, and you can also swap out Rifle Turret for Throw Mine for more CC, and Photon Wall for Personal Battering Ram if you need even more CC.

Magnetic Shield (Shield 4) is also 3s long projectile reflect, while Static Shield (Shield 5) is a 2.5s long block, and can be used as your panic button.

A.E.D. will heal you to 12,280 HP if you take lethal damage, and can also be used as another panic button.
